headline: This World Prematurity Day, Pampers is enabling essential moments of bonding, as 92% of parents of premature babies said that physical touch made them feel more connected to their little ones[1]
summary: Touch is crucial to all babies' development, but with skin twice as thin as that of a full-term baby, premature babies' skin can often be very fragile[2]. Despite this vulnerability, skin-to-skin contact is crucial for their development, as it significantly boosts oxytocin[3] levels, an important hormone for familial bonding.

thumbnail.caption: Pampers Ambassador Oti Mabuse holding a Preemie Protection nappy. (PRNewsfoto/Pampers)
